info.title: Samsara API
info.description:
# Introduction
The Samsara REST API lets you interact with the Samsara Cloud from anything that can send an HTTP request. With the Samsara API you can build powerful applications and custom solutions with sensor data.

Samsara has endpoints available to track and analyze sensors, vehicles, and entire fleets. If you’re familiar with what you can build with a REST API, the following API reference guide will be your go-to resource.

API access to the Samsara cloud is available to all Samsara administrators. If you’d like to try the API, [contact us](https://www.samsara.com/free-trial). The API is currently in beta and may be subject to frequent changes.

# Connecting to the API
There are two ways to connect to the API. If you prefer to use the API in Javascript or Python, we supply SDKs which you can download here: [Javascript SDK](https://github.com/samsarahq/samsara-js), [Python SDK](https://github.com/samsarahq/samsara-python).

If you’d rather use another language to interact with the Samsara API, the endpoints and examples are in the reference guide below.

post.summary: This method returns a list of the sensor objects in the Samsara Cloud and information about them.
This method returns the current ambient temperature (and probe temperature if applicable) for the requested sensors.

200.description: List of sensor objects containing the current temperature reported by each sensor.

post.summary: This method returns the current relative humidity for the requested sensors.

200.description: List of sensor objects containing the current humidity reported by each sensor.

post.summary: This method returns a set of historical data for the specified sensors in the specified time range and at the specified time resolution.

parameters.name: historyParam
parameters.description: Group ID, time range and resolution, and list of sensor ID, field pairs to query.

startMs.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

endMs.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

stepMs.description: Time resolution for which data should be returned, in milliseconds.
stepMs.example: Specifying 3600000 will return data at hour intervals.

items.description: Sensor ID and field to query.

200.description: List of results objects, each containing a time and a datapoint for each requested sensor/field pair.

post.summary: This method returns a list of the vehicles in the Samsara Cloud and information about them.

200.description: List of vehicles and information about each.

post.summary: This method returns the current location in latitude and longitude of all vehicles in a requested group.

200.description: List of vehicle objects containing their location and the time at which that location was logged.

post.summary: This method returns a set of historical trips data for the specified vehicle in the specified time range.

parameters.name: tripsParam
parameters.description: Group ID, vehicle ID and time range to query.

startMs.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

endMs.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

200.description: List of trips taken by the requested vehicle within the specified timeframe.

post.summary: Get all the drivers for the specified group.
Get the HOS (hours of service) logs for the specified driver.

200.description: HOS logs for the specified driver.

post.summary: This method adds an address book entry to the specified group.

name.description: Name of the location to add to the address book.

address.description: The address of the entry to add, as it would be recognized if provided to maps.google.com.

radius.description: Radius in meters of the address (used for matching vehicle trip stops to this location).

200.description: Address was successfully added. No response body is returned.

post.summary: This method enables the mutation of metadata for vehicles in the Samsara Cloud.

200.description: Vehicles were successfully updated. No response body is returned.

post.summary: Get the dispatch jobs for the specified group.

200.description: Dispatch jobs for the specified group.

post.summary: Create dispatch jobs in the specified group.

200.description: Dispatch jobs created for the specified group as a result of the request.
Dispatch jobs updated for the specified group as a result of the request.

VehicleLocation.description: Contains the location, in latitude and longitude, of a vehicle.

location.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

time.description: The time the reported location was logged, reported as a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds.

TemperatureResponse.description: Contains the current temperatures of a sensor.

ambientTemperature.description: Currently reported ambient temperature in millidegrees celsius.

probeTemperature.description: Currently reported probe temperature in millidegrees celsius. If no probe is connected, this parameter will not be reported.

HumidityResponse.description: Contains the current humidity of a sensor.

humidity.description: Currently reported relative humidity in percent, from 0-100.

TripResponse.description: Contains the trips for the vehicle in the requested timeframe. A trip is represented as an object that contains startMs, startLocation, startCoordinates, endMs, endLocation, and endCoordinates.

startMs.description: Beginning of the trip in UNIX milliseconds.

startLocation.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to the start (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

endMs.description: End of the trip in UNIX milliseconds.

endLocation.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to the end (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

ErrorResponse.description: Contains the error response when a request fails.

SensorHistoryResponse.description: Contains the results for a sensor history request. Each result contains a timestamp and datapoint for each requested (sensor, field) pair.

series.description: List of datapoints, one for each requested (sensor, field) pair.

sensorParam.name: sensorParam
sensorParam.description: Group ID and list of sensor IDs to query.

sensors.description: List of sensor IDs to query.
